1: <sup>1</sup> Let not your heart be troubled: ye believe in God, believe also in me.
2: <sup>2</sup> In my Father’s house are many mansions: if it were not so, I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you.
3: <sup>3</sup> And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again, and receive you unto myself; that where I am, there ye may be also.
4: <sup>4</sup> And whither I go ye know, and the way ye know.
5: <sup>5</sup> Thomas saith unto him, Lord, we know not whither thou goest; and how can we know the way?
6: <sup>6</sup> Jesus saith unto him, I am the way, the truth, and the life: no man cometh unto the Father, but by me.
7: <sup>7</sup> If ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also: and from henceforth ye know him, and have seen him.
8: <sup>8</sup> Philip saith unto him, Lord, shew us the Father, and it sufficeth us.
9: <sup>9</sup> Jesus saith unto him, Have I been so long time with you, and yet hast thou not known me, Philip? he that hath seen me hath seen the Father; and how sayest thou then, Shew us the Father?
10: <sup>10</sup> Believest thou not that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? the words that I speak unto you I speak not of myself: but the Father that dwelleth in me, he doeth the works.
11: <sup>11</sup> Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father in me: or else believe me for the very works’ sake.
12: <sup>12</sup> Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me, the works that I do shall he do also; and greater works than these shall he do; because I go unto my Father.
13: <sup>13</sup> And whatsoever ye shall ask in my name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
14: <sup>14</sup> If ye shall ask any thing in my name, I will do it.
15: <sup>15</sup> If ye love me, keep my commandments.
16: <sup>16</sup> And I will pray the Father, and he shall give you another Comforter, that he may abide with you for ever;
17: <sup>17</sup> Even the Spirit of truth; whom the world cannot receive, because it seeth him not, neither knoweth him: but ye know him; for he dwelleth with you, and shall be in you.
18: <sup>18</sup> I will not leave you comfortless: I will come to you.
19: <sup>19</sup> Yet a little while, and the world seeth me no more; but ye see me: because I live, ye shall live also.
20: <sup>20</sup> At that day ye shall know that I am in my Father, and ye in me, and I in you.
21: <sup>21</sup> He that hath my commandments, and keepeth them, he it is that loveth me: and he that loveth me shall be loved of my Father, and I will love him, and will manifest myself to him.
22: <sup>22</sup> Judas saith unto him, not Iscariot, Lord, how is it that thou wilt manifest thyself unto us, and not unto the world?
23: <sup>23</sup> Jesus answered and said unto him, If a man love me, he will keep my words: and my Father will love him, and we will come unto him, and make our abode with him.
24: <sup>24</sup> He that loveth me not keepeth not my sayings: and the word which ye hear is not mine, but the Father’s which sent me.
25: <sup>25</sup> These things have I spoken unto you, being yet present with you.
26: <sup>26</sup> But the Comforter, which is the Holy Ghost, whom the Father will send in my name, he shall teach you all things, and bring all things to your remembrance, whatsoever I have said unto you.
27: <sup>27</sup> Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.
28: <sup>28</sup> Ye have heard how I said unto you, I go away, and come again unto you. If ye loved me, ye would rejoice, because I said, I go unto the Father: for my Father is greater than I.
29: <sup>29</sup> And now I have told you before it come to pass, that, when it is come to pass, ye might believe.
30: <sup>30</sup> Hereafter I will not talk much with you: for the prince of this world cometh, and hath nothing in me.
31: <sup>31</sup> But that the world may know that I love the Father; and as the Father gave me commandment, even so I do. Arise, let us go hence.
32: <sup>32</sup> Or else, while the other is yet a great way off, he sendeth an ambassage, and desireth conditions of peace.
33: <sup>33</sup> So likewise, whosoever he be of you that forsaketh not all that he hath, he cannot be my disciple.
34: <sup>34</sup> Salt is good: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be seasoned?
35: <sup>35</sup> It is neither fit for the land, nor yet for the dunghill; but men cast it out. He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
36: <sup>36</sup> And he said, Abba, Father, all things are possible unto thee; take away this cup from me: nevertheless not what I will, but what thou wilt.
37: <sup>37</sup> And he cometh, and findeth them sleeping, and saith unto Peter, Simon, sleepest thou? couldest not thou watch one hour?
38: <sup>38</sup> Watch ye and pray, lest ye enter into temptation. The spirit truly is ready, but the flesh is weak.
39: <sup>39</sup> And again he went away, and prayed, and spake the same words.
40: <sup>40</sup> And when he returned, he found them asleep again, (for their eyes were heavy,) neither wist they what to answer him.
41: <sup>41</sup> And he cometh the third time, and saith unto them, Sleep on now, and take your rest: it is enough, the hour is come; behold, the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
42: <sup>42</sup> Rise up, let us go; lo, he that betrayeth me is at hand.
43: <sup>43</sup> And immediately, while he yet spake, cometh Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.
44: <sup>44</sup> And he that betrayed him had given them a token, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, that same is he; take him, and lead him away safely.
45: <sup>45</sup> And as soon as he was come, he goeth straightway to him, and saith, Master, master; and kissed him.
46: <sup>46</sup> And they laid their hands on him, and took him.
47: <sup>47</sup> And one of them that stood by drew a sword, and smote a servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.
48: <sup>48</sup> And Jesus answered and said unto them, Are ye come out, as against a thief, with swords and with staves to take me?
49: <sup>49</sup> I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and ye took me not: but the scriptures must be fulfilled.
50: <sup>50</sup> And they all forsook him, and fled.
51: <sup>51</sup> And there followed him a certain young man, having a linen cloth cast about his naked body; and the young men laid hold on him:
52: <sup>52</sup> And he left the linen cloth, and fled from them naked.
53: <sup>53</sup> And they led Jesus away to the high priest: and with him were assembled all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes.
54: <sup>54</sup> And Peter followed him afar off, even into the palace of the high priest: and he sat with the servants, and warmed himself at the fire.
55: <sup>55</sup> And the chief priests and all the council sought for witness against Jesus to put him to death; and found none.
56: <sup>56</sup> For many bare false witness against him, but their witness agreed not together.
57: <sup>57</sup> And there arose certain, and bare false witness against him, saying,
58: <sup>58</sup> We heard him say, I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and within three days I will build another made without hands.
59: <sup>59</sup> But neither so did their witness agree together.
60: <sup>60</sup> And the high priest stood up in the midst, and asked Jesus, saying, Answerest thou nothing? what is it which these witness against thee?
61: <sup>61</sup> But he held his peace, and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked him, and said unto him, Art thou the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?
62: <sup>62</sup> And Jesus said, I am: and ye shall see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power, and coming in the clouds of heaven.
63: <sup>63</sup> Then the high priest rent his clothes, and saith, What need we any further witnesses?
64: <sup>64</sup> Ye have heard the blasphemy: what think ye? And they all condemned him to be guilty of death.
65: <sup>65</sup> And some began to spit on him, and to cover his face, and to buffet him, and to say unto him, Prophesy: and the servants did strike him with the palms of their hands.
66: <sup>66</sup> And as Peter was beneath in the palace, there cometh one of the maids of the high priest:
67: <sup>67</sup> And when she saw Peter warming himself, she looked upon him, and said, And thou also wast with Jesus of Nazareth.
68: <sup>68</sup> But he denied, saying, I know not, neither understand I what thou sayest. And he went out into the porch; and the cock crew.
69: <sup>69</sup> And a maid saw him again, and began to say to them that stood by, This is one of them.
70: <sup>70</sup> And he denied it again. And a little after, they that stood by said again to Peter, Surely thou art one of them: for thou art a Galilaean, and thy speech agreeth thereto.
71: <sup>71</sup> But he began to curse and to swear, saying, I know not this man of whom ye speak.
72: <sup>72</sup> And the second time the cock crew. And Peter called to mind the word that Jesus said unto him, Before the cock crow twice, thou shalt deny me thrice. And when he thought thereon, he wept.
